ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient presents with progressive, flat, moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cochlear implant candidacy (off-label)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Speech recognition scores meet CI criteria (<60% best aided), though pure-tone thresholds show more residual hearing than typical candidates.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder (ANSD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to patient report of 'good/bad days' but ruled out by presence of ABR waves I, III, and V.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess degree and configuration of hearing loss and monitor threshold shifts.
To evaluate word recognition abilities, which had significantly declined.
To assess middle ear function and acoustic reflex pathways.
To assess outer hair cell function; absent results consistent with hearing loss magnitude.
To verify hearing aid fittings against DSL targets during trial.
To measure functional gain with optimized hearing aids.
To evaluate functional speech understanding for CI candidacy (HINT, CNC).
To rule out Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder given patient history.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial evaluation revealed a flat, moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss with a recent threshold shift and significant decline in word recognition scores. Middle ear function was normal, but reflexes and OAEs were absent, consistent with the degree of cochlear hearing loss.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Flat, moderately severe SNHL; recent shift of 0-5 dB (Right) and 5-10 dB (Left).

tests.name: Tympanometry & Reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal tympanograms (Type A); absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes at 500-1000 Hz.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Hearing aid verification and trial were conducted. Loaner aids were verified to meet DSL targets; patient reported settings comfortable.

tests.name: Real Ear Measures (REM)
tests.result_summary: Loaner aids adjusted to meet adult DSL targets; patient reported settings comfortable.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Upon return, the patient reported no noticeable functional improvement. Aided sound-field thresholds were measured but the goal of 25 dB HL was not met. ABR testing ruled out ANSD.

tests.name: Aided Soundfield Thresholds
tests.result_summary: 30-45 dB HL range achieved; goal of 25 dB HL not met.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Wave I, III, V complex present; ruled out ANSD.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Following a 1-month trial, speech perception scores fell within CI candidacy criteria despite the 'off-label' residual hearing.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise / Speech Perception
tests.result_summary: HINT (Quiet) 59% binaural, 30% left; CNC 32% binaural. Scores met CI candidacy criteria.

proposed_items: Post-operative aural rehabilitation (auditory-based therapy) for minimum 2 months
counseling_actions: Discuss 'off-label' candidacy status due to significant residual hearing.
Counsel on the risk of losing natural residual hearing in the implanted ear.
Explain recommendation for left ear implantation to preserve the better right ear for telephone use.
Manage expectations regarding variability in CI performance.
Discuss insurance approval process for off-label cases.

escalation.rationale_short: Patient meets functional criteria for cochlear implantation despite off-label audiometric thresholds and has not benefited from optimized amplification.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Post-operative activation and long-term follow-up (e.g., 3 years 7 months mentioned).
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor aided thresholds, speech recognition performance, and acclimatization to the implant.

expected_outcome: Aided sound-field thresholds with the CI alone showed improvement compared to preoperative hearing aids and remained stable at 3 years 7 months post-activation.

Speech recognition scores (HINT-Quiet, HINT +10 dB SNR, and CNC words) demonstrated significant benefit compared to preoperative performance, with improvements observed at 2 months, 5 months, 1 year, and 2.7 years.
Patient reported significant functional improvement, describing the ability to converse in a noisy restaurant without lip-reading and stating she was 'blown away' by what she could hear.
